com.tacticalenterprisesltd

Class WhereCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tacticalenterprisesltd.WhereCondition

  • public class WhereCondition
extends java.lang.Object
    Use this class to set conditions on a WHERE clause for a query. By default the operand is the equals "=" symbol. You can change this to: <,>,<=,>=,LIKE, BETWEEN, IS NULL, IS NOT NULL, etc. If you have an instance where you want to apply a condition that tests if a field is null or not null see the following example: //For A Select query: SELECT * FROM basic WHERE basic.city IS NULL
    Field fld3 = new Field("basic","city", Field.Type.STRING);
    WhereCondition wc = new WhereCondition(fld3,"","IS NULL");
     Another scenario would be to test between two dates: //For A Select query: SELECT * FROM basic WHERE basic.registered_date BETWEEN '2011-07-02' AND '2011-12-23'
    Field fld4 = new Field("basic","registered_date", Field.Type.DATE);
    DateFormat df = new DateFormat(fld4, "yyyy-MM-dd");
    fld4.setDatePattern("yyyy-MM-dd");
    WhereCondition wc = new WhereCondition(fld4,"'2011-07-02' AND '2011-12-23'","BETWEEN");
    Version:
    1.5.0
    Author:
    Alan Shiers
